page.title: 06Brackenbury Cliff,Felixstowe
page.content: {Brackenbury Barracks}are right on the cliff top and a{bomb disposal unit of the Royal Engineers is stationed here. The men are Ukranian. The unit has been here since the First World War. The work done is classified. {A hang_gliding club}called the "Suffolk Floaters" uses the cliff. Brackenbury Cliff is the highest point along this section of the coast at which it is safe to fly. The air rises up the steep cliff and causes a{lift {band}which is necessary for hang-gliding. They hang-glide along the cliff and not out to sea as this would cause them to leave the lift band with disastrous results! The cliff is a good view-point and is popular with residents and holiday makers. There are many beach huts here which tend to be unsightly.
